intro: Kniphofia ankaratrensis, commonly known as the Ankaratra torch lily, is a striking perennial plant native to the high-altitude grasslands of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Hemerocallidaceae and is characterized by its tall, sturdy stems that bear clusters of vivid orange-red tubular flowers. The plant produces long, narrow leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern at the base. Kniphofia ankaratrensis is well adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native habitat, showcasing resilience and ornamental value. Its unique appearance makes it a sought-after species in horticulture and botanical gardens.
